adjectives.description: aboil (comparative more aboil, superlative most aboil)

entries.meaning: In a boil; boiling. [First attested in the mid 19th century.]
examples: The cooking, I can tell you, kept her nose to the pot, and even if there was nothing in it, even though there was no pot, she had to keep watching that it came aboil just the same.

entries.meaning: (figurative) Heated up; excited. [First attested in the mid 19th century.]
examples: He plugged on steadily, unmindful of where he was going. He was aboil with perturbation.

entries.meaning: In a boil; boiling. [First attested in the mid 19th century.]
(figurative) Heated up; excited. [First attested in the mid 19th century.]
